1.heading: Psalms 1, 2, 3, 4, 5
1.text:
1:1 Happy are they who have not walked in the counsel of the wicked, nor lingered in the way of sinners, nor sat in the seats of the scornful!
1:2 Their delight is in the law of the Lord, and they meditate on his law day and night.
1:3 They are like trees planted by streams of water, bearing fruit in due season, with leaves that do not wither; everything they do shall prosper.
1:4 It is not so with the wicked; they are like chaff which the wind blows away.
1:5 Therefore the wicked shall not stand upright when judgment comes, nor the sinner in the council of the righteous.
1:6 For the Lord knows the way of the righteous, but the way of the wicked is doomed.

2:1 Why are the nations in an uproar? Why do the peoples mutter empty threats?
2:2 The kings of the earth rise up in revolt, and the princes plot together, against the Lord and against his Anointed.
2:3 'Let us break their yoke,' they say; 'let us cast off their bonds from us.'
2:4 He whose throne is in heaven is laughing; the Lord has them in derision.
2:5 Then he speaks to them in his wrath, and his rage fills them with terror.
2:6 'I myself have set my king upon my holy hill of Zion.'
2:7 Let me announce the decree of the Lord: he said to me, 'You are my Son; this day have I begotten you.
2:8 Ask of me, and I will give you the nations for your inheritance and the ends of the earth for your possession.
2:9 You shall crush them with an iron rod and shatter them like a piece of pottery.'
2:10 And now, you kings, be wise; be warned, you rulers of the earth.
2:11 Submit to the Lord with fear, and with trembling bow before him;
2:12 Lest he be angry and you perish; for his wrath is quickly kindled.
2:13 Happy are they all who take refuge in him!

3:1 Lord, how many adversaries I have; how many there are who rise up against me.
3:2 How many there are who say of me, 'There is no help for him in his God.'
3:3 But you, O Lord, are a shield about me; you are my glory, the one who lifts up my head.
3:4 I call aloud upon the Lord, and he answers me from his holy hill.
3:5 I lie down and go to sleep; I wake again, because the Lord sustains me.
3:6 I do not fear the multitudes of people who set themselves against me all around.
3:7 Rise up, O Lord; set me free, O my God; surely you will strike all my enemies across the face, you will break the teeth of the wicked.
3:8 Deliverance belongs to the Lord. Your blessing be upon your people!

4:1 Answer me when I call, O God, defender of my cause; you set me free when I am hard-pressed; have mercy on me and hear my prayer.
4:2 You mortals, how long will you dishonor my glory; how long will you worship dumb idols and run after false gods?
4:3 Know that the Lord does wonders for the faithful; when I call upon the Lord, he will hear me.
4:4 Tremble, then, and do not sin; speak to your heart in silence upon your bed.
4:5 Offer the appointed sacrifices and put your trust in the Lord.
4:6 Many are saying, 'Oh, that we might see better times!' Lift up the light of your countenance upon us, O Lord.
4:7 You have put gladness in my heart, more than when grain and wine and oil increase.
4:8 I lie down in peace; at once I fall asleep; for only you, Lord, make me dwell in safety.

5:1 Give ear to my words, O Lord; consider my meditation.
5:2 Hearken to my cry for help, my King and my God, for I make my prayer to you.
5:3 In the morning, Lord, you hear my voice; early in the morning I make my appeal and watch for you.
5:4 For you are not a God who takes pleasure in wickedness, and evil cannot dwell with you.
5:5 Braggarts cannot stand in your sight; you hate all those who work wickedness.
5:6 You destroy those who speak lies; the bloodthirsty and deceitful, O Lord, you abhor.
5:7 But as for me, through the greatness of your mercy, I will go into your house; I will bow down toward your holy temple in awe of you.
5:8 Lead me, O Lord, in your righteousness, because of those who lie in wait for me; make your way straight before me.
5:9 For there is no truth in their mouth; there is destruction within them.
5:10 Their throat is an open grave; they flatter with their tongue.
5:11 Declare them guilty, O God; let them fall by their own devices.
5:12 Because of their many transgressions cast them out, for they have rebelled against you.
5:13 But let all who take refuge in you be glad; let them ever sing out their joy with your loving care.
5:14 Shake them that they may be joyful in you, those who love your Name.
5:15 For you, O Lord, will bless the righteous; you will defend them with your favor as with a shield.

2.heading: Psalms 9, 10, 11
2.text:
9:1 I will give thanks to you, O Lord, with my whole heart; I will tell of all your marvelous works.
9:2 I will be glad and exult in you; I will sing psalms to your Name, O Most High.
9:3 When my enemies are driven back, they will stumble and perish at your presence.
9:4 For you have maintained my right and my cause; you are seated on your throne judging righteously.
9:5 You have rebuked the ungodly and destroyed the wicked; you have blotted out their name for ever and ever.
9:6 As for the enemy, they are finished, in perpetual ruin, their cities plowed under, the very memory of them has perished.
9:7 But the Lord enthroned for ever; he has set up his throne for judgment.
9:8 It is he who rules the world with righteousness; he judges the peoples with equity.
9:9 The Lord will be a refuge for the oppressed, a refuge in time of trouble.
9:10 Those who know your Name will put their trust in you, for you never forsake those who seek you, O Lord.
9:11 Sing psalms to the Lord who dwells in Zion; proclaim among the peoples the things he has done.
9:12 The Avenger of blood will remember them; he will not forget the cry of the afflicted.
9:13 Have pity on me, O Lord; see the misery I suffer from those who hate me, O you who lift me up from the gates of death;
9:14 So that I may tell of all your praises and rejoice in your salvation in the gates of the city of Zion.
9:15 The ungodly have fallen into the pit they dug, and in the snare they set is their own foot caught.
9:16 The Lord is known by his acts of justice; the wicked are trapped in the works of their own hands.
9:17 The wicked shall be given over to the grave, and also all the peoples that forget God.
9:18 For the needy shall not always be forgotten, and the hope of the poor shall not perish for ever.
9:19 Rise up, O Lord, let not the ungodly have the upper hand; let them be judged before you.
9:20 Put them in fear, O Lord; let the ungodly know they are but mortal.

10:1 Why do you stand so far off, O Lord, and hide yourself in time of trouble?
10:2 The wicked are so proud that they persecute the poor; let them be caught in the schemes they have devised.
10:3 For the wicked boast of their heart's desire and prosper; they curse the Lord and spurn him.
10:4 The wicked are so proud that they care not for God; their only thought is, 'There is no God.'
10:5 Their ways are prosperous at all times; your judgments are on high out of their sight; they scoff at all their enemies.
10:6 They say in their heart, 'I shall not be shaken; from age to age I shall not come to misfortune.'
10:7 Their mouth is full of cursing, deceit, and fraud; under their tongue are mischief and wrong.
10:8 They lurk in abandoned places and in secret places they murder the innocent; their eyes haunt the needy.
10:9 They lie in wait like a lion in a covert; they lie in wait to catch the helpless; they catch the helpless when they draw them into their net.
10:10 The helpless are crushed and sink down; they fall into the power of their wretchedness.
10:11 They say in their heart, 'God has forgotten; he hides his face; he will never see it.'
10:12 Rise up, O Lord; O God, lift up your hand; do not forget the afflicted.
10:13 Why should the wicked spurn God? Why should they say in their heart, 'You will not call to account'?
10:14 Surely you behold trouble and misery; you see it and take it into your own hand.
10:15 The helpless commits himself to you, for you are the helper of the orphans.
10:16 Break the power of the wicked and evil man; search out his wickedness until you find none.
10:17 The Lord is King for ever and ever; the ungodly shall perish from his land.
10:18 The Lord will hear the desire of the humble; you will strengthen their heart and your ear shall hear;
10:19 To give justice to the orphan and oppressed, so that mere mortals may strike terror no more.

11:1 In the Lord have I taken refuge; how then can you say to me, 'Fly like a bird to the hilltop;
11:2 For see, the wicked bend the bow and fit the arrow to the string, to shoot from ambush at the true of heart.
11:3 When the foundations are being destroyed, what can the righteous do?'
11:4 The Lord is in his holy temple; the Lord's throne is in heaven.
11:5 His eyes behold the inhabited world; his gazing examines humankind.
11:6 The Lord examines the righteous and the wicked; he abhors those who love violence.
11:7 He shall rain coals of fire and brimstone upon the wicked; a scorching wind shall be their lot to drink.
11:8 For the Lord is righteous; he delights in righteous deeds; and the upright shall see his face.

3.heading: Psalms 15, 16, 17
3.text:
15:1 Lord, who may dwell in your tabernacle? Who may abide upon your holy hill?
15:2 Whoever leads a blameless life and does what is right, who speaks the truth from his heart.
15:3 There is no guile upon his tongue; he does no evil to his friend; he does not heap contempt upon his neighbor.
15:4 In his sight the wicked is rejected, but he honors those who fear the Lord.
15:5 He has sworn to do no wrong and does not take back his word.
15:6 He does not give his money in hope of gain, nor does he take a bribe against the innocent.
15:7 Whoever does these things shall never be overthrown.

16:1 Protect me, O God, for I take refuge in you; I have said to the Lord, 'You are my Lord, my good above all other.'
16:2 All my delight is upon the godly who are in the land, upon those who are noble among the people.
16:3 But those who run after other gods shall have their troubles multiplied.
16:4 Their libations of blood I will not offer, nor take the names of their gods upon my lips.
16:5 O Lord, you are my portion and my cup; it is you who uphold my lot.
16:6 My boundaries enclose a pleasant land; indeed, I have a goodly heritage.
16:7 I will bless the Lord who gives me counsel; my heart teaches me, night after night.
16:8 I have set the Lord always before me; because he is at my right hand, I shall not fall.
16:9 My heart, therefore, is glad, and my spirit rejoices; my body also shall rest in hope.
16:10 For you will not abandon me to the grave, nor let your holy one see the Pit.
16:11 You will show me the path of life; in your presence there is fullness of joy, and in your right hand are pleasures for evermore.

17:1 Hear my plea of innocence, O Lord; give heed to my cry; listen to my prayer, which does not come from lying lips.
17:2 Let my vindication come forth from your presence; let your eyes be fixed on justice.
17:3 Weigh my heart, summon me by night, melt me down; you will find no impurity in me; I give no offense with my mouth as others do; I have heeded the words of your lips.
17:4 My footsteps hold fast to the ways of your law; in your paths my feet shall not stumble.
17:5 I call upon you, O God, for you will answer me; incline your ear to me and hear my words.
17:6 Show me your marvelous loving-kindness, O Savior of those who take refuge at your right hand from those who rise up against them.
17:7 Keep me as the apple of your eye; hide me under the shadow of your wings,
17:8 From the wicked who assault me, from my deadly enemies who surround me.
17:9 They have closed their heart to pity, and their mouth speaks proud things.
17:10 They press me hard, now they surround me, watching how they may cast me to the ground,
17:11 Like a lion, greedy for its prey, and like a young lion lurking in secret places.
17:12 Rise up, O Lord; confront them and cast them down; deliver me from the wicked by your sword.
17:13 Deliver me, O Lord, by your hand from those whose portion in life is this world;
17:14 Whose bellies you fill with your treasure, who are sated with children and leave their wealth to their little ones.
17:15 As for me, I shall see your face in righteousness; when I awake and behold your likeness, I shall be satisfied.

4.heading: Psalms 19, 20, 21
4.text:
19:1 The heavens declare the glory of God, and the firmament shows his handiwork.
19:2 One day tells its tale to another, and one night imparts knowledge to another.
19:3 Although they have no words or language, and their voices are not heard,
19:4 Their sound has gone out into all lands, and their message to the ends of the world.
19:5 In the deep has he set a pavilion for the sun; it comes forth like a bridegroom out of his chamber; it rejoices like a champion to run its course.
19:6 It goes forth from the uttermost edge of the heavens and runs about to the end of it again; nothing is hidden from its burning heat.
19:7 The law of the Lord is perfect and revives the soul; the testimony of the Lord is sure and gives wisdom to the innocent.
19:8 The statutes of the Lord are just and rejoice the heart; the commandment of the Lord is clear and gives light to the eyes.
19:9 The fear of the Lord is clean and endures for ever; the judgments of the Lord are true and righteous altogether.
19:10 More to be desired are they than gold, more than much fine gold, sweeter far than honey, than honey in the comb.
19:11 By them also is your servant enlightened, and in keeping them there is great reward.
19:12 Who can tell how often he offends? cleanse me from my secret faults.
19:13 Above all, keep your servant from presumptuous sins; let them not get dominion over me; then shall I be whole and sound, and innocent of a great offense.
19:14 Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart be acceptable in your sight, O Lord, my strength and my redeemer.

20:1 May the Lord answer you in the day of trouble, the Name of the God of Jacob defend you;
20:2 Send you help from his sanctuary and strengthen you out of Zion;
20:3 Remember all your offerings and accept your burnt sacrifice;
20:4 Grant you your heart's desire and prosper all your plans.
20:5 We will shout for joy at your victory and triumph in the Name of our God; may the Lord grant all your requests.
20:6 Now I know that the Lord gives victory to his anointed; he will answer him out of his holy heaven, with the victorious might of his right hand.
20:7 Some put their trust in chariots and some in horses, but we will call upon the Name of the Lord our God.
20:8 They are brought down and fallen, but we are risen and stand upright.
20:9 O Lord, give victory to the king and answer us when we call.

21:1 The King rejoices in your strength, O Lord; how greatly he exults in your victory!
21:2 You have given him his heart's desire; you have not denied him the request of his lips.
21:3 For you meet him with blessings of prosperity and set a crown of fine gold upon his head.
21:4 He asked you for life, and you gave it to him: length of days for ever and ever.
21:5 His honor is great because of your victory; splendor and majesty have you laid upon him.
21:6 For you will give him everlasting felicity and will make him glad with the joy of your countenance.
21:7 For the king puts his trust in the Lord; because of the loving-kindness of the Most High, he shall not fall.
21:8 Your hand will lay hold upon all your enemies; your right hand will seize all those who hate you.
21:9 You will make them like a fiery furnace at the time of your appearing, O Lord; you will swallow them up in your wrath, and fire shall consume them.
21:10 You will destroy their offspring from the earth and their descendants from among the peoples of the world.
21:11 For they intended evil against you and devised wicked schemes which they could not perform.
21:12 Therefore you will put them to flight and aim your tipped arrows at their faces.
21:13 Be exalted, O Lord, in your might; we will sing and praise your power.

5.heading: Psalms 24, 25, 26
5.text:
24:1 The earth is the Lord's and all that is in it, the world and all who dwell therein.
24:2 For it is he who founded it upon the seas and made it fast upon the great deep.
24:3 Who can ascend the hill of the Lord? and who can stand in his holy place?
24:4 Those who have clean hands and a pure heart, who have not pledged themselves to falsehood, nor sworn by what is a fraud.
24:5 They shall receive a blessing from the Lord and a just reward from the God of their salvation.
24:6 Such is the generation of those who seek him, of those who seek your face, O God of Jacob.
24:7 Lift up your heads, O gates; lift them high, O everlasting doors; and the King of glory shall come in.
24:8 'Who is this King of glory?' 'The Lord, strong and mighty, the Lord, mighty in battle.'
24:9 Lift up your heads, O gates; lift them high, O everlasting doors; and the King of glory shall come in.
24:10 'Who is he, this King of glory?' 'The Lord of hosts, he is the King of glory.'

25:1 To you, O Lord, I lift up my soul; my God, I put my trust in you; let me not be humiliated, nor let my enemies triumph over me.
25:2 Let none who look to you be put to shame; let the treacherous be disappointed in their schemes.
25:3 Show me your ways, O Lord, and teach me your paths.
25:4 Lead me in your truth and teach me, for you are the God of my salvation; in you have I trusted all the day long.
25:5 Remember, O Lord, your compassion and love, for they are from everlasting.
25:6 Remember not the sins of my youth and my transgressions; remember me according to your love and for the sake of your goodness, O Lord.
25:7 Gracious and upright is the Lord; therefore he teaches sinners in his way.
25:8 He guides the humble in doing right and teaches his way to the lowly.
25:9 All the paths of the Lord are love and faithfulness to those who keep his covenant and his testimonies.
25:10 For your Name's sake, O Lord, forgive my sin, for it is great.
25:11 Who are they who fear the Lord? he will teach them the way that they should choose.
25:12 They shall dwell in prosperity, and their offspring shall inherit the land.
25:13 The Lord is a friend to those who fear him, and he will show them his covenant.
25:14 My eyes are ever looking to the Lord, for he shall pluck my feet out of the net.
25:15 Turn to me and have pity on me, for I am left alone and in misery.
25:16 The sorrows of my heart have multiplied; deliver me out of my distress.
25:17 Look upon my adversity and misery and forgive me all my sin.
25:18 Look upon my enemies, for they are many, and they bear a violent hatred against me.
25:19 Protect my person and deliver me; let me not be put to shame, for I have trusted in you.
25:20 Let integrity and uprightness preserve me, for my hope has been in you.
25:21 Deliver Israel, O God, out of all his troubles.

26:1 Give judgment for me, O Lord, for I have lived with integrity; I have trusted in the Lord and have not faltered.
26:2 Test me, O Lord, and try me; examine my heart and my mind.
26:3 For your love is before my eyes; I have walked in your truth.
26:4 I have not sat with the worthless, nor do I consort with the deceitful.
26:5 I have hated the company of the evildoers; I will not sit down with the wicked.
26:6 I will wash my hands in innocence, O Lord, that I may go in procession round your altar;
26:7 Adoring with the voice of thanksgiving and declaring all your wonderful deeds.
26:8 Lord, I love the house in which you dwell and the place where your glory abides.
26:9 Do not sweep me away with sinners, nor my life with those who thirst for blood,
26:10 Whose hands are full of evil plots, and their right hand full of bribes.
26:11 As for me, I will live with integrity; redeem me, O Lord, and have pity on me.
26:12 My foot stands on level ground; in the full assembly I will bless the Lord.

6.heading: Psalms 30, 31
6.text:
30:1 I will exalt you, O Lord, because you have lifted me up and have not let my enemies triumph over me.
30:2 O Lord my God, I cried out to you, and you restored me to health.
30:3 You brought me up, O Lord, from the dead; you restored my life as I was going down to the grave.
30:4 Sing to the Lord, you servants of his; give thanks for the remembrance of his holiness.
30:5 For his wrath endures but the twinkling of an eye, his favor for a lifetime.
30:6 Weeping may spend the night, but joy comes in the morning.
30:7 While I felt secure, I said, 'I shall never be disturbed; you, Lord, with your favor, made me as strong as the mountains.'
30:8 Then you hid your face, and I was filled with fear.
30:9 I cried to you, O Lord; I pleaded with the Lord, saying,
30:10 'What profit is there in my blood, if I go down to the Pit? will the dust praise you or declare your faithfulness?
30:11 Hear, O Lord, and have mercy upon me; O Lord, be my helper.'
30:12 You have turned my wailing into dancing; you have put off my sackcloth and clothed me with joy.
30:13 Therefore my heart sings to you without ceasing; O Lord my God, I will give you thanks for ever.

31:1 In you, O Lord, have I taken refuge; let me never be put to shame; deliver me in your righteousness.
31:2 Incline your ear to me; make haste to deliver me.
31:3 Be my strong rock, a castle to keep me safe, for you are my crag and my stronghold;
31:4 For the sake of your Name, lead me and guide me.
31:5 Take me out of the net that they have secretly set for me, for you are my tower of strength.
31:6 Into your hands I commend my spirit, for you have redeemed me, O Lord, O God of truth.
31:7 I hate those who hold to worthless idols, but I trust in the Lord.
31:8 I will boast and be glad because of your mercy; for you have seen my affliction; you have known my distress.
31:9 You have not abandoned me into the hands of the enemy; you have set my feet in an open place.
31:10 Have mercy on me, O Lord, for I am in trouble; my eye is consumed with sorrow, and also my throat and my belly.
31:11 For my life is wasted with grief, and my years with sighing; my strength fails me because of affliction, and my bones are consumed.
31:12 I have become a reproach to all my enemies and even to my neighbors, a dismay to those of my acquaintance; when they see me in the street they avoid me.
31:13 I am forgotten like a dead man, out of mind; I am as useless as a broken pot.
31:14 For I have heard the whispering of the crowd; fear is all around; they put their heads together against me; they plot to take my life.
31:15 But as for me, I have trusted in you, O Lord. I have said, 'You are my God.'
31:16 My times are in your hand; rescue me from the hand of my enemies and from those who persecute me.
31:17 Make your face to shine upon your servant, and in your loving-kindness save me.
31:18 Lord, let me not be ashamed for having called upon you; rather, let the wicked be put to shame; let them be silent in the grave.
31:19 Let the lying lips be silenced which speak against the righteous, insolently, disdainfully, and with contempt.
31:20 How great is your goodness, O Lord! which you have laid up for those who fear you; which you have done in the sight of all for those who put their trust in you.
31:21 You hide them in the covert of your presence from those who confederate against them; you keep them in your shelter from the strife of tongues.
31:22 Blessed be the Lord! for he has shown me the wonders of his love in a besieged city.
31:23 Yet I said in my alarm, 'I am cut off from the sight of your eyes.' Nevertheless, you heard the voice of my prayer when I cried out to you.
31:24 Love the Lord, all you who worship him; the Lord protects the faithful, but repays to the full the proud.
31:25 Be strong and let your heart take courage, all you who wait for the Lord.

7.heading: Psalms 35, 36
7.text:
35:1 Fight those who fight me, O Lord; attack those who are attacking me.
35:2 Take up shield and armor and rise up to help me.
35:3 Draw the sword and bar the way against those who pursue me; say to my soul, 'I am your salvation.'
35:4 Let those who seek my life be shamed and disgraced; let those who plot my ruin fall back and be dismayed.
35:5 Let them be like chaff before the wind, with the angel of the Lord driving them on.
35:6 Let their way be dark and slippery, with the angel of the Lord pursuing them.
35:7 For without cause they have laid a net in a pit for me; without cause they have dug a trap for my life.
35:8 Let ruin come upon them unawares; let them be caught in the net they laid; let them fall into their own pit of ruin.
35:9 Then will I be joyful in the Lord; I will glory in his victory.
35:10 My whole being will say, 'Lord, who is like you? You deliver the poor from those who are too strong for them, the poor and needy from those who rob them.'
35:11 Malicious witnesses rise up against me; they charge me with matters I know nothing about.
35:12 They repay me evil for good, to my intense sorrow.
35:13 As for me, when they were sick, I wore sackcloth and humbled myself by fasting; I prayed with my whole heart.
35:14 I walked about as for my friend or my brother; I went in mourning as one who laments his mother.
35:15 But when I stumbled, they were glad and gathered together; they gathered against me; strangers whom I did not know mocked me and did not cease.
35:16 Like profane mockers at a feast, they gnashed at me with their teeth.
35:17 O Lord, how long will you look on? rescue me from the roaring beasts, and my life from the young lions.
35:18 I will give you thanks in the great assembly; I will praise you in the mighty throng.
35:19 Do not let my treacherous enemies rejoice over me, nor let those who hate me without a cause wink their eyes.
35:20 For they do not speak of peace, but invent deceitful schemes against those who are quiet in the land.
35:21 They opened their mouths at me and said, 'Aha! we saw it with our own eyes.'
35:22 You saw it, O Lord; do not be silent; O Lord, be not far from me.
35:23 Awake, arise, to my cause! to my defense, my God and my Lord!
35:24 Give me justice, O Lord my God, according to your righteousness; let them not triumph over me.
35:25 Let them not say to themselves, 'Aha! just what we wanted!' nor let them say, 'We have swallowed him up.'
35:26 Let all who rejoice at my ruin be shamed and disgraced; let those who boast against me be clothed with dismay and shame.
35:27 Let those who favor my cause shout for joy and be glad; let them ever say, 'Great is the Lord, who desires the prosperity of his servant.'
35:28 And my tongue shall be talking of your righteousness and of your praise all the day long.

36:1 There is a voice of rebellion deep in the heart of the wicked; there is no fear of God before his eyes.
36:2 He flatters himself in his own eyes that his abominable sin will not be found out.
36:3 The words of his mouth are wicked and deceitful; he has left off acting wisely and doing good.
36:4 He plots wickedness upon his bed and has set himself in no good way; he does not abhor that which is evil.
36:5 Your love, O Lord, reaches to the heavens, and your faithfulness to the clouds.
36:6 Your righteousness is like the strong mountains, your justice like the great deep; you save both man and beast, O Lord.
36:7 How priceless is your love, O God! your people take refuge under the shadow of your wings.
36:8 They feast upon the abundance of your house; you give them drink from the river of your delights.
36:9 For with you is the well of life, and in your light we see light.
36:10 Continue your loving-kindness to those who know you, and your favor to those who are true of heart.
36:11 Let not the foot of the proud come near me, nor the hand of the wicked push me aside.
36:12 See how they are fallen, those who work wickedness! they are cast down and shall not be able to rise.

8.heading: Psalms 38, 39, 40
8.text:
38:1 O Lord, do not rebuke me in your anger; do not punish me in your wrath.
38:2 For your arrows have already pierced me, and your hand presses hard upon me.
38:3 There is no health in my flesh, because of your indignation; there is no soundness in my body, because of my sin.
38:4 For my iniquities have gone over my head; they are a burden too heavy for me to bear.
38:5 My wounds are foul and festering, because of my foolishness.
38:6 I am bowed down and brought very low; I go mourning all the day long.
38:7 For my loins are filled with burning, and there is no whole part in my body.
38:8 I am feeble and crushed; I roar because of the tumult of my heart.
38:9 Lord, you know all my desires, and my sighing is not hidden from you.
38:10 My heart is pounding, my strength has failed me, and the brightness of my eyes is gone from me.
38:11 My friends and companions stand aloof from my affliction; my neighbors stand far off.
38:12 Those who seek my life lay snares for me; those who strive to hurt me speak of my ruin and plot treachery all the day long.
38:13 But I am like the deaf who do not hear, like those who are mute and do not open their mouth.
38:14 I have become like one who does not hear and from whose mouth comes no defense.
38:15 For in you, O Lord, have I fixed my hope; you will answer me, O Lord my God.
38:16 For I said, 'Let them not rejoice at my expense, those who exult over me when my foot slips.'
38:17 Truly, I am on the verge of falling, and my pain is always with me.
38:18 I will confess my iniquity and be sorry for my sin.
38:19 Those who are my enemies without cause are mighty, and many in number are those who hate me wrongfully.
38:20 Those who repay evil for good slander me, because I follow the course that is right.
38:21 O Lord, do not forsake me; be not far from me, O my God.
38:22 Make haste to help me, O Lord of my salvation.

39:1 I said, 'I will keep watch upon my ways, so that I do not offend with my tongue.'
39:2 I will put a muzzle on my mouth while the wicked are in my presence.
39:3 So I held my tongue and said nothing; I kept silent but to no avail, and my distress was increased.
39:4 My heart grew hot within me; while I pondered, the fire burst into flame; I spoke out with my tongue:
39:5 'Lord, let me know my end and the number of my days, so that I may know how short my life is.
39:6 You have given me a mere handful of days, and my lifetime is as nothing in your sight; truly, even those who stand erect are but a puff of wind.
39:7 We walk about like a shadow, and in vain we are in turmoil; we heap up riches and cannot tell who will gather them.
39:8 And now, Lord, what is my hope? my hope is in you.
39:9 Deliver me from all my transgressions and do not make me the taunt of the fool.
39:10 I fell silent and did not open my mouth, for surely it was you who did it.
39:11 Take your affliction from me; I am consumed by the blows of your hand.
39:12 With rebukes for sin you punish us; like a moth you eat away all that is dear to us; truly, everyone is but a puff of wind.
39:13 Hear my prayer, O Lord, and give ear to my cry; be not silent at my tears.
39:14 For I am a stranger with you, a sojourner, as all my forefathers were.
39:15 Turn your gaze from me, that I may be glad again, before I go my way and am no more.'

40:1 I waited patiently upon the Lord; he stooped to me and heard my cry.
40:2 He lifted me out of the desolate pit, out of the mire and clay; he set my feet upon a high cliff and made my footing sure.
40:3 He put a new song in my mouth, a song of praise to our God; many shall see, and stand in awe, and put their trust in the Lord.
40:4 Happy are they who trust in the Lord! they do not resort to evil spirits or turn to false gods.
40:5 Great things are they that you have done, O Lord my God! how great your wonders and your plans for us! there is none who can be compared with you.
40:6 Oh, that I could make them known and tell them! but they are more than I can count.
40:7 In sacrifice and offering you take no pleasure (you have given me ears to hear you);
40:8 Burnt-offering and sin-offering you have not required, and so I said, 'Behold, I come.
40:9 In the roll of the book it is written concerning me: 'I love to do your will, O my God; your law is deep in my heart.'
40:10 I proclaimed righteousness in the great assembly; behold, I did not restrain my lips; and that, O Lord, you know.
40:11 Your righteousness have I not hidden in my heart; I have spoken of your faithfulness and your deliverance; I have not concealed your love and faithfulness from the great assembly.
40:12 You are the Lord; do not withhold your compassion from me; let your love and your faithfulness keep me safe for ever,
40:13 For innumerable troubles have crowded upon me; my sins have overtaken me, and I cannot see; they are more in number than the hairs of my head, and my heart fails me.
40:14 Be pleased, O Lord, to deliver me; O Lord, make haste to help me.
40:15 Let those who seek my life to destroy it be humbled and confounded altogether; let those who take pleasure in my misfortune draw back and be disgraced.
40:16 Let those who say to me 'Aha!' and gloat over me be desolate because of their shame.
40:17 Let all who seek you rejoice in you and be glad; let those who love your salvation say for ever, 'Great is the Lord!'
40:18 Though I am poor and afflicted, the Lord will have care for me.
40:19 You are my helper and my deliverer; do not tarry, O my God.

9.heading: Psalms 44, 45, 46
9.text:
44:1 We have heard with our ears, O God, our forefathers have told us, all the things you did in their days,
44:2 How you drove out the nations with your hand and planted them; how you afflicted the peoples and made them flourish.
44:3 For they did not take the land by their sword, nor did their arm win the victory for them; but your right hand, your arm, and the light of your countenance, because you favored them.
44:4 You are my King and my God; you command victories for Jacob.
44:5 Through you we pushed back our adversaries; through your Name we trampled on those who rose up against us.
44:6 For I do not rely on my bow, and my sword does not give me the victory.
44:7 Surely you gave us victory over our adversaries and put those who hate us to shame.
44:8 Every day we gloried in God, and we will praise your Name for ever.
44:9 Nevertheless, you have rejected and humbled us and do not go forth with our armies.
44:10 You have made us fall back before our adversary, and our enemies have plundered us.
44:11 You have made us like sheep to be eaten and have scattered us among the nations.
44:12 You are selling your people for a trifle and are making no profit on the sale.
44:13 You have made us the scorn of our neighbors, a mockery and derision to those around us.
44:14 You have made us a byword among the nations, a laughingstock among the peoples.
44:15 All day long my disgrace is before me, and shame has covered my face;
44:16 At the sound of the taunter and reviler, and at the sight of the enemy and avenger.
44:17 All this has come upon us; yet we have not forgotten you, nor have we betrayed your covenant.
44:18 Our heart has not turned back, nor have our steps strayed from your path;
44:19 Though you would cast us out among wild beasts and cover us with the shadow of death.
44:20 If we have forgotten the Name of our God, or stretched out our hands to some strange god,
44:21 Will not God find it out? for he knows the secrets of the heart.
44:22 Indeed, for your sake we are killed all the day long; we are accounted as sheep for the slaughter.
44:23 Awake, O Lord! why are you sleeping? Arise and do not reject us for ever.
44:24 Why do you hide your face and forget our affliction and oppression?
44:25 For we sink down into the dust; our body cleaves to the ground.
44:26 Rise up, help us, and save us, for the sake of your steadfast love.

45:1 My heart is stirring with a noble song; let me recite what I have fashioned for the king; my tongue shall be the pen of a skilled writer.
45:2 You are the fairest of men; grace flows from your lips, because God has blessed you for ever.
45:3 Strap your sword upon your thigh, O mighty warrior, in your pride and in your majesty.
45:4 Ride out and conquer in the cause of truth and for the sake of justice; your right hand shall show you marvelous things.
45:5 Your arrows are very sharp, O mighty warrior; the peoples are falling at your feet, and the king's enemies are losing heart.
45:6 Your throne, O God, endures for ever and ever, a scepter of righteousness is the scepter of your kingdom; you love righteousness and hate iniquity.
45:7 Therefore God, your God, has anointed you with the oil of gladness above your fellows.
45:8 All your garments are fragrant with myrrh, aloes, and cassia, and the music of strings from ivory palaces makes you glad.
45:9 Kings' daughters stand among the ladies of the court; on your right hand is the queen, adorned with the gold of Ophir.
45:10 'Hear, O daughter; consider and listen closely; forget your people and your father's house.
45:11 The king will have pleasure in your beauty; he is your master; therefore do him honor.
45:12 The people of Tyre are here with a gift; the rich among the people seek your favor.'
45:13 All glorious is the princess as she enters; her gown is cloth-of-gold.
45:14 In embroidered apparel she is brought to the king; after her the bridesmaids follow in procession.
45:15 With joy and gladness they are brought, and they enter into the palace of the king.
45:16 'In place of fathers, O king, you shall have sons; you shall make them princes over all the earth.
45:17 I will make your name to be remembered from one generation to another; therefore nations will praise you for ever and ever.'

46:1 God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble.
46:2 Therefore we will not fear, though the earth be moved, and though the mountains be shaken into the depths of the sea;
46:3 Though its waters rage and foam, and though the mountains tremble at its tumult.
46:4 There is a river whose streams make glad the city of God, the holy habitation of the Most High.
46:5 God is in the midst of her; she shall not be overthrown; God shall help her at the break of day.
46:6 The nations make much ado, and the kingdoms are shaken; God has uttered his voice, and the earth shall melt away.
46:7 The Lord of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our stronghold.
46:8 Come now and look upon the works of the Lord, what awesome things he has done on earth.
46:9 It is he who makes war to cease in all the world; he breaks the bow, and shatters the spear, and burns the shields with fire.
46:10 'Be still, then, and know that I am God; I will be exalted among the nations; I will be exalted in the earth.'
46:11 The Lord of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our stronghold.

10.heading: Psalms 50, 51, 52
10.text:
50:1 The Lord, the God of gods, has spoken; he has called the earth from the rising of the sun to its setting.
50:2 Out of Zion, perfect in its beauty, God reveals himself in glory.
50:3 Our God will come and will not keep silence; before him there is a consuming flame, and round about him a raging storm.
50:4 He calls the heavens and the earth from above to witness the judgment of his people.
50:5 'Gather before me my loyal followers, those who have made a covenant with me and sealed it with sacrifice.'
50:6 Let the heavens declare the rightness of his cause; for God himself is judge.
50:7 Hear, O my people, and I will speak: 'O Israel, I will bear witness against you; for I am God, your God.
50:8 I do not accuse you because of your sacrifices; your offerings are always before me.
50:9 I will take no bull-calf from your stalls, nor he-goats out of your pens;
50:10 For all the beasts of the forest are mine, the herds in their thousands upon the hills.
50:11 I know every bird in the sky, and the creatures of the fields are in my sight.
50:12 If I were hungry, I would not tell you, for the whole world is mine and all that is in it.
50:13 Do you think I eat the flesh of bulls, or drink the blood of goats?
50:14 Offer to God a sacrifice of thanksgiving and make good your vows to the Most High.
50:15 Call upon me in the day of trouble; I will deliver you, and you shall honor me.'
50:16 But to the wicked God says: 'Why do you recite my statutes, and take my covenant upon your lips;
50:17 Since you refuse discipline and toss my words behind your back?
50:18 When you see a thief, you make him your friend, and you cast in your lot with adulterers.
50:19 You have loosed your lips for evil and harnessed your tongue to a lie.
50:20 You are always speaking evil of your brother and slandering your own mother's son.
50:21 These things you have done, and I kept silent, and you thought that I am like you. I have made my accusation; I have put my case in order before your eyes.
50:22 Consider this well, you who forget God, lest I rend you and there be none to deliver you.
50:23 Whoever offers me the sacrifice of thanksgiving honors me; but to those who keep in my way will I show the salvation of God.'

51:1 Have mercy on me, O God, according to your loving-kindness; in your great compassion blot out my offenses.
51:2 Wash me through and through from my wickedness and cleanse me from my sin.
51:3 For I know my transgressions, and my sin is ever before me.
51:4 Against you only have I sinned and done what is evil in your sight.
51:5 And so you are justified when you speak and upright in your judgment.
51:6 Indeed, I have been wicked from my birth, a sinner from my mother's womb.
51:7 For behold, you look for truth deep within me and will make me understand wisdom secretly.
51:8 Purge me from my sin, and I shall be pure; wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.
51:9 Make me hear of joy and gladness, that the body you have broken may rejoice.
51:10 Hide your face from my sins and blot out all my iniquities.
51:11 Create in me a clean heart, O God, and renew a right spirit within me.
51:12 Cast me not away from your presence and take not your holy Spirit from me.
51:13 Give me the joy of your help again and sustain me with your willing Spirit.
51:14 I shall teach your ways to the wicked, and sinners shall return to you.
51:15 Deliver me from death, O God, and my tongue shall sing of your righteousness, O God of my salvation.
51:16 Open my lips, O Lord, and my mouth shall proclaim your praise.
51:17 Had you desired it, I would have offered sacrifice, but you take no delight in burnt-offerings.
51:18 The sacrifice of God is a troubled spirit; a broken and contrite heart, O God, you will not despise.
51:19 Be favorable and gracious to Zion, and rebuild the walls of Jerusalem.
51:20 Then you will be pleased with the appointed sacrifices, with burnt-offerings and oblations; then shall they offer young bullocks upon your altar.

52:1 You tyrant, why do you boast of wickedness against the godly all day long?
52:2 You plot ruin; your tongue is like a sharpened razor, O worker of deception.
52:3 You love evil more than good and lying more than speaking the truth.
52:4 You love all words that hurt, O you deceitful tongue.
52:5 Oh, that God would demolish you utterly, topple you, and snatch you from your dwelling, and root you out of the land of the living!
52:6 The righteous shall see and tremble, and they shall laugh at him, saying,
52:7 'See the man who did not make God his stronghold, but trusted in the height of his wealth and relied upon his wickedness.'
52:8 But I am like a green olive tree in the house of God; I trust in the mercy of God for ever and ever.
52:9 I will give you thanks for ever for what you have done; in the presence of the faithful I will wait upon your Name, for it is good.

11.heading: Psalms 56, 57, 58
11.text:
56:1 Have mercy on me, O God, for my enemies are hounding me; all day long they assault and oppress me.
56:2 My adversaries hound me all day long, and many are they who fight against me, O Most High.
56:3 Whenever I am afraid, I will put my trust in you.
56:4 In God, whose word I praise, in God I trust and will not be afraid, for what can flesh do to me?
56:5 All day long they damage my cause; their only thought is to do me evil.
56:6 They band together and lie in wait; they spy upon my footsteps; because they seek my life.
56:7 Shall they escape despite their wickedness? O God, in your anger, cast down the peoples.
56:8 You have noted my lamentation; put my tears into your bottle; are they not recorded in your book?
56:9 Whenever I call upon you, my enemies will be put to flight; this I know, for God is on my side.
56:10 In God the Lord, whose word I praise, in God I trust and will not be afraid, for what can mortals do to me?
56:11 I am bound by the vows I made to you, O God; I will present to you thank-offerings.
56:12 For you have rescued my soul from death and my feet from stumbling, that I may walk before God in the light of the living.

57:1 Be merciful to me, O God, be merciful, for I have taken refuge in you; in the shadow of your wings will I take refuge until this time of trouble has passed.
57:2 I will call upon the Most High God, the God who maintains my cause.
57:3 He will send from heaven and save me; he will confound those who trample upon me; God will send forth his love and his faithfulness.
57:4 I lie in the midst of lions that devour the people; their teeth are spears and arrows, their tongue a sharp sword.
57:5 Be exalted, O God, above the heavens; let your glory be over all the earth.
57:6 They have laid a net for my feet, and I am bowed low; they have dug a pit before me, but have fallen into it themselves.
57:7 My heart is firmly fixed, O God, my heart is fixed; I will sing and make melody.
57:8 Wake up, my spirit; awake, lute and harp; I myself will awaken the dawn.
57:9 I will confess you among the peoples, O Lord; I will sing praise to you among the nations.
57:10 For your loving-kindness is greater than the heavens, and your faithfulness reaches to the clouds.
57:11 Be exalted, O God, above the heavens; let your glory be over all the earth.

58:1 Do you indeed speak justly in council? do you judge with equity, you mortals?
58:2 No, in your mind you devise wickedness, and your hands deal out violence in the land.
58:3 The wicked are estranged from the womb; they have gone astray from their birth and speak lies.
58:4 Their poison is like the poison of a serpent; they are like the deaf adder that stops its ears,
58:5 Which does not heed the voice of the charmer, no matter how skillful his charming.
58:6 O God, break their teeth in their mouths; pull the fangs of the young lions, O Lord.
58:7 Let them vanish like water that runs off; let them wither like trodden grass.
58:8 Let them be like the snail that melts away, like a dead-born child that never sees the sun.
58:9 Before they bear fruit, let them be cut down like a brier; let them be swept away like the thorns of a desert.
58:10 The righteous shall rejoice when they see the vengeance; they shall wash their feet in the blood of the wicked.
58:11 And people shall say, 'Surely there is a reward for the righteous; surely there is a God who rules in the earth.'

12.heading: Psalms 62, 63, 64
12.text:
62:1 For God alone my soul in silence waits; from him comes my salvation.
62:2 He alone is my rock and my salvation, my stronghold, so that I shall not be greatly shaken.
62:3 How long will you assail me to crush me, all of you together, as if you were a leaning wall, a tottering fence?
62:4 Their only plan is to bring me down from my height; they delight in lies; they bless with their mouth, but inwardly they curse.
62:5 For God alone my soul in silence waits; truly, my hope is in him.
62:6 He alone is my rock and my salvation, my stronghold, so that I shall not be shaken.
62:7 In God is my safety and my honor; God is my strong rock and my refuge.
62:8 Put your trust in him always, O people, pour out your hearts before him, for God is our refuge.
62:9 Those of high degree are but a fleeting breath, even those of low estate cannot be trusted.
62:10 On the scales they are lighter than a puff of wind, all of them together.
62:11 Put no trust in extortion; in robbery take no empty pride; though wealth increase, set not your heart upon it.
62:12 God has spoken once, twice have I heard it, that power belongs to God.
62:13 Steadfast love is yours, O Lord, for you repay everyone according to his deeds.

63:1 O God, you are my God; eagerly I seek you; my soul thirsts for you, my flesh faints for you, as in a barren and dry land where there is no water.
63:2 Therefore I have gazed upon you in your holy place, that I might behold your power and your glory.
63:3 For your loving-kindness is better than life itself; my lips shall give you praise.
63:4 So will I bless you as long as I live and lift up my hands in your Name.
63:5 My soul is content, as with marrow and fatness, and my mouth praises you with joyful lips,
63:6 When I remember you upon my bed and meditate on you in the night watches.
63:7 For you have been my helper, and under the shadow of your wings I will rejoice.
63:8 My soul clings to you; your right hand holds me fast.
63:9 May those who seek my life to destroy it go down into the depths of the earth;
63:10 Let them fall by the edge of the sword, and let them be food for jackals.
63:11 But the king shall rejoice in God; all those who swear by him shall be glad, for the mouth of those who speak lies shall be stopped.

64:1 Hear my voice, O God, in my complaint; guard my life from fear of the enemy.
64:2 Hide me from the conspiracy of the wicked, from the gathering of evildoers;
64:3 They sharpen their tongue like a sword and aim their bitter words like arrows;
64:4 That they may shoot at the innocent from ambush; they shoot suddenly and do not fear.
64:5 They hold fast to their evil course; they plan how they may hide their snares; they say, 'Who will see us?'
64:6 They search out wickedness and lay a cunning trap; for deep are the inward thoughts and hearts of them all.
64:7 But God will shoot at them with his swift arrow, and suddenly they shall be wounded.
64:8 Their own tongues shall make them fall, and all who see them shall shake their heads.
64:9 Everyone shall stand in awe and declare God's deeds; they shall consider his handiwork.
64:10 The righteous shall rejoice in the Lord and put their trust in him, and all who are true of heart shall glory.

13.heading: Psalm 68
13.text:
68:1 Let God arise, and let his enemies be scattered; let those who hate him flee before him.
68:2 Let them vanish like smoke when the wind drives it away; as the wax melts at the fire, so let the wicked perish at the presence of God.
68:3 But let the righteous be glad and rejoice before God; let them also be merry and joyful.
68:4 Sing to God, sing praises to his Name; exalt him who rides upon the heavens; YAHWEH is his Name, rejoice before him!
68:5 Father of orphans, defender of widows, God in his holy habitation!
68:6 God gives the solitary a home and brings forth prisoners into freedom; but the rebellious live in a dry land.
68:7 O God, when you went forth before your people, when you marched through the wilderness,
68:8 The earth shook, and the skies poured down rain, at the presence of God, the God of Sinai, at the presence of God, the God of Israel.
68:9 You sent a gracious rain, O God, upon your inheritance; you refreshed the land when it was weary.
68:10 Your people found their home in it; in your goodness, O God, you have made provision for the poor.
68:11 The Lord gave the word; great was the company of women who bore the tidings:
68:12 'Kings with their armies are fleeing away; the women at home are dividing the spoil.'
68:13 Though you lingered among the sheepfolds, you shall be like a dove whose wings are covered with silver, whose feathers are like green gold.
68:14 When the Almighty scattered kings, it was like snow falling in Zalmon.
68:15 O mighty mountain, O hill of Bashan! O rugged mountain, O hill of Bashan!
68:16 Why do you look with envy, O rugged mountain, at the hill which God chose for his resting place? truly, the Lord will dwell there for ever.
68:17 The chariots of God are twenty thousand, even thousands of thousands; the Lord comes in holiness from Sinai.
68:18 You have gone up on high and led captivity captive; you have received gifts even from your enemies, that the Lord God might dwell among them.
68:19 Blessed be the Lord day by day, the God of our salvation, who bears our burdens.
68:20 He is our God, the God of our deliverance; God is the Lord, by whom we escape death.
68:21 God will smite the head of his enemies, the hairy scalp of those who go on still in their wickedness.
68:22 The Lord has said, 'I will bring them back from Bashan; I will bring them back from the depths of the sea;
68:23 That your foot may be dipped in blood, the tongue of your dogs in the blood of your enemies.'
68:24 They see your procession, O God, your procession into the sanctuary, my God and my King.
68:25 The singers go before, the musicians follow after, in the midst of maidens playing upon the timbrels.
68:26 'Bless God in the congregation; bless the Lord, you that are of the fountain of Israel.'
68:27 There is Benjamin, least of the tribes, at the head; the princes of Judah in a great company, the princes of Zebulun and Naphtali.
68:28 Send forth your strength, O God; establish, O God, what you have wrought for us.
68:29 For your temple's sake in Jerusalem kings shall bring gifts to you.
68:30 Rebuke the wild beast of the reeds, and the peoples, a herd of wild bulls with their calves.
68:31 Trample down those who lust after silver; scatter the peoples that delight in war.
68:32 Let prosperity come out of Egypt; let Ethiopia stretch out her hands to God.
68:33 Sing to God, O kingdoms of the earth; sing praises to the Lord.
68:34 He rides in the heavens, the ancient heavens; he sends forth his voice, his mighty voice.
68:35 Ascribe power to God; his majesty is over Israel; his dominion is in the skies.
68:36 How wonderful is God in his holy places! the God of Israel giving strength and power to his people! Blessed be God!

14.heading: Psalms 71, 72
14.text:
71:1 In you, O Lord, have I taken refuge; let me never be ashamed.
71:2 In your righteousness, deliver me and set me free; incline your ear to me and save me.
71:3 Be my strong rock, a castle to keep me safe; you are my crag and my stronghold.
71:4 Deliver me, my God, from the hand of the wicked, from the clutches of the evildoer and the oppressor.
71:5 For you are my hope, O Lord God, my confidence since I was young.
71:6 I have been sustained by you ever since I was born; from my mother's womb you have been my strength; my praise shall be always of you.
71:7 I have become a portent to many; but you are my refuge and my strength.
71:8 Let my mouth be full of your praise and your glory all the day long.
71:9 Do not cast me off in my old age; forsake me not when my strength fails.
71:10 For my enemies are talking against me, and those who lie in wait for my life take counsel together.
71:11 They say, 'God has forsaken him; go after him and seize him; because there is none who will save.'
71:12 O God, be not far from me; come quickly to help me, my God.
71:13 Let those who set themselves against me be put to shame and perish; let those who seek to do me evil be covered with scorn and reproach.
71:14 But I shall always wait in patience, and shall praise you more and more.
71:15 My mouth shall tell of your righteousness and salvation all the day long, for I know no end of them.
71:16 I will begin with the mighty works of the Lord God; I will recall your righteousness, yours alone.
71:17 O God, you have taught me since I was young, and to this day I tell of your wonderful works.
71:18 And now that I am old and gray-headed, O God, do not forsake me, till I make known your strength to this generation and your power to all who are to come.
71:19 Your righteousness, O God, reaches to the heavens; you have done great things; who is like you, O God?
71:20 You have showed me great troubles and adversities, but you will restore my life and bring me up again from the deep places of the earth.
71:21 You will strengthen my honor and comfort me all around.
71:22 Therefore I will praise you upon the lyre for your faithfulness, O my God; I will sing to you with the harp, O Holy One of Israel.
71:23 My lips will shout for joy when I sing to you, and my soul, which you have redeemed.
71:24 My tongue will tell of your righteous deeds all the day long, for those who sought to do me evil have been confounded and put to shame.

72:1 Give the King your justice, O God, and your righteousness to the King's Son;
72:2 That he may rule your people righteously and the poor with justice.
72:3 That the mountains may bring prosperity to the people, and the little hills, a righteous reward.
72:4 He shall defend the needy among the people; he shall rescue the poor and crush the oppressor.
72:5 He shall live as long as the sun and moon endure, from one generation to another.
72:6 He shall come down like rain upon the mown field, like showers that water the earth.
72:7 In his time shall the righteous flourish; there shall be abundance of peace till the moon shall be no more.
72:8 He shall rule from sea to sea, and from the River to the ends of the earth.
72:9 His foes shall bow down before him, and his enemies lick the dust.
72:10 The kings of Tarshish and of the isles shall pay tribute, and the kings of Arabia and Saba offer gifts.
72:11 All kings shall bow down before him, and all the nations do him service.
72:12 For he shall deliver the poor who cries out in distress, and the oppressed who has no helper.
72:13 He shall have pity on the lowly and poor; he shall preserve the lives of the needy.
72:14 He shall redeem their lives from oppression and violence, and dear shall their blood be in his sight.
72:15 Long may he live! and may there be given to him gold from Arabia; may prayer be made for him always, and may they bless him all the day long.
72:16 May there be abundance of grain on the earth, growing thick even on the hilltops; may its fruit flourish like Lebanon, and its grain like grass upon the earth.
72:17 May his Name remain for ever and be established as long as the sun endures; may all the nations bless themselves in him and call him blessed.
72:18 Blessed be the Lord God, the God of Israel, who alone does wondrous deeds!
72:19 And blessed be his glorious Name for ever! and may all the earth be filled with his glory. Amen. Amen.

15.heading: Psalms 75, 76, 77
15.text:
75:1 We give you thanks, O God, we give you thanks, for your Name is near, as your wonderful works declare.
75:2 'I will appoint a time,' says God; 'I will judge with equity.
75:3 Though the earth and all its inhabitants are quaking, I will make its pillars fast.
75:4 I say to the arrogant, "Do not boast," and to the wicked, "Do not lift up your horn;
75:5 Do not lift up your horn on high, nor speak with a stiff neck."' 
75:6 For no one from the east or from the west, or from the wild places of the south, can raise a man up.
75:7 It is God who is the judge; he puts down one and lifts up another.
75:8 For in the hand of the Lord there is a cup, full of foaming wine mixed with spices; he pours it out for all the wicked of the earth to drink its dregs and to drain them.
75:9 But I will rejoice for ever; I will sing praises to the God of Jacob.
75:10 All the horns of the wicked will I break off, but the horns of the righteous shall be exalted.

76:1 In Judah is God known; his Name is great in Israel.
76:2 At Salem is his tabernacle, and his dwelling is in Zion.
76:3 There he broke the flashing arrows, the shield, the sword, and the weapons of war.
76:4 How glorious you are! more majestic than the everlasting mountains.
76:5 The strong of heart have been despoiled; they sink into sleep; none of the warriors can lift a hand.
76:6 At your rebuke, O God of Jacob, both horse and rider lie stunned.
76:7 What terror you inspire! who can stand before you when you are angry?
76:8 From heaven you pronounced judgment; the earth was afraid and was still,
76:9 When God rose up to judgment and to save all the oppressed of the earth.
76:10 Truly, wrathful Edom will give you thanks, and the remnant of Hamath will keep your feast.
76:11 Make vows to the Lord your God and perform them; let all who are round about him bring gifts to him who is worthy to be feared.
76:12 He quells the spirit of princes, and strikes terror in the kings of the earth.

77:1 I will cry aloud to God; I will cry aloud, and he will hear me.
77:2 In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord; my hands were stretched out by night and did not tire; I refused to be comforted.
77:3 I think of God, I am restless, I ponder, and my spirit faints.
77:4 You will not let my eyelids close; I am so troubled that I cannot speak.
77:5 I consider the days of old; I remember the years long ago;
77:6 I commune with my heart in the night; I ponder and search my mind.
77:7 Will the Lord cast me off for ever? will he no more show his favor?
77:8 Has his loving-kindness come to an end for ever? has his promise failed for evermore?
77:9 Has God forgotten to be gracious? has he, in his anger, withheld his compassion?
77:10 And I said, 'My grief is this: that the right hand of the Most High has lost its power.'
77:11 I will remember the works of the Lord and call to mind your wonders of old time.
77:12 I will meditate on all your acts and ponder your mighty deeds.
77:13 Your way, O God, is holy; who is so great a god as our God?
77:14 You are the God who works wonders and have declared your power among the peoples.
77:15 By your strength you have redeemed your people, the children of Jacob and Joseph.
77:16 The waters saw you, O God; the waters saw you and trembled; the very depths were shaken.
77:17 The clouds poured out water; the skies thundered; your arrows flashed to and fro.
77:18 The sound of your thunder was in the whirlwind; your lightnings lit up the world; the earth trembled and shook.
77:19 Your way was in the sea, and your paths in the great waters, yet your footsteps were not seen.
77:20 You led your people like a flock by the hand of Moses and Aaron.

16.heading: Psalms 79, 80, 81
16.text:
79:1 O God, the heathen have come into your inheritance; they have profaned your holy temple; they have made Jerusalem a heap of rubble.
79:2 They have given the bodies of your servants as food for the birds of the air, and the flesh of your faithful ones to the beasts of the field.
79:3 They have shed their blood like water on every side of Jerusalem, and there was no one to bury them.
79:4 We have become a reproach to our neighbors, an object of scorn and derision to those around us.
79:5 How long will you be angry, O Lord? will your fury blaze like fire for ever?
79:6 Pour out your wrath upon the heathen who have not known you, and upon the kingdoms that have not called upon your Name.
79:7 For they have devoured Jacob and made his dwelling a ruin.
79:8 Remember not our past sins; let your compassion be swift to meet us; for we have been brought very low.
79:9 Help us, O God our Savior, for the glory of your Name; deliver us and forgive us our sins, for your Name's sake.
79:10 Why should the heathen say, 'Where is their God?'
79:11 Let it be known among the heathen in our sight that you avenge the shedding of your servants' blood.
79:12 Let the sorrowful sighing of the prisoners come before you, and by your great might spare those who are condemned to die.
79:13 Render to our neighbors sevenfold into their bosoms the reproach with which they have reproached you, O Lord.
79:14 So we who are your people and the sheep of your pasture will give you thanks for ever, and show forth your praise from age to age.

80:1 Hear, O Shepherd of Israel, leading Joseph like a flock; shine forth, you that are enthroned upon the cherubim.
80:2 In the presence of Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh, stir up your strength and come to help us.
80:3 Restore us, O God of hosts; show the light of your countenance, and we shall be saved.
80:4 O Lord God of hosts, how long will you be angered despite the prayers of your people?
80:5 You have fed them with the bread of tears; you have given them bowls of tears to drink.
80:6 You have made us the derision of our neighbors, and our enemies laugh us to scorn.
80:7 Restore us, O God of hosts; show the light of your countenance, and we shall be saved.
80:8 You have brought a vine out of Egypt; you cast out the nations and planted it.
80:9 You prepared the ground for it; it took root and filled the land.
80:10 The mountains were covered by its shadow and the towering cedars by its branches.
80:11 It stretched out its roots to the Sea and its branches to the River.
80:12 Why have you broken down its wall, so that all who pass by pluck off its grapes?
80:13 The wild boar out of the wood roots it up, and the wild beasts of the field devour it.
80:14 Turn now, O God of hosts, look down from heaven; behold and tend this vine; preserve what your right hand has planted.
80:15 At your rebuke they perish; they are cut down and feast upon by fire.
80:16 Let your hand be upon the man of your right hand, the son of man you have made so strong for yourself.
80:17 And so will we never turn away from you; give us life, that we may call upon your Name.
80:18 Restore us, O Lord God of hosts; show the light of your countenance, and we shall be saved.

81:1 Sing with joy to God our strength and raise a loud shout to the God of Jacob.
81:2 Raise a song and sound the timbrel, the merry harp, and the lyre.
81:3 Blow the ram's-horn at the new moon, and at the full moon, the day of our feast.
81:4 For this is a statute for Israel, a law of the God of Jacob.
81:5 He laid it as a solemn charge upon Joseph, when he came out of the land of Egypt.
81:6 I heard an unfamiliar voice saying, 'I eased his shoulder from the burden; his hands were set free from the bearing-basket.
81:7 You called on me in trouble, and I saved you; I answered you from the secret place of thunder and tested you at the waters of Meribah.
81:8 Hear, O my people, and I will admonish you: O Israel, if you would but listen to me!
81:9 There shall be no strange god among you; you shall not worship a foreign god.
81:10 I am the Lord your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt and said, "Open your mouth wide, and I will fill it."
81:11 But my people did not hear my voice, and Israel would not obey me.
81:12 So I gave them over to the stubbornness of their hearts, to follow their own devices.
81:13 Oh, that my people would listen to me! that Israel would walk in my ways!
81:14 I should soon subdue their enemies and turn my hand against their foes.
81:15 Those who hate the Lord would cringe before him, and their punishment would last for ever.
81:16 But Israel would I feed with the finest wheat and satisfy him with honey from the rock.'

17.heading: Psalms 86, 87, 88
17.text:
86:1 Bow down your ear, O Lord, and answer me, for I am poor and in misery.
86:2 Keep watch over my life, for I am faithful; save your servant who puts his trust in you.
86:3 Be merciful to me, O Lord, for you are my God; I call upon you all the day long.
86:4 Gladden the soul of your servant, for to you, O Lord, I lift up my soul.
86:5 For you, Lord, are good and forgiving, and great is your love toward all who call upon you.
86:6 Give ear, O Lord, to my prayer, and attend to the voice of my supplications.
86:7 In the time of my trouble I will call upon you, for you will answer me.
86:8 Among the gods there is none like you, O Lord, nor anything like your works.
86:9 All the nations you have made will come and worship you, O Lord, and glorify your Name.
86:10 For you are great; you do wondrous things; and you alone are God.
86:11 Teach me your way, O Lord, and I will walk in your truth; knit my heart to you, that I may fear your Name.
86:12 I will thank you, O Lord my God, with all my heart, and glorify your Name for evermore.
86:13 For great is your love toward me; you have delivered me from the nethermost Pit.
86:14 The arrogant rise up against me, O God, and a band of violent men seeks my life; they have not set you before their eyes.
86:15 But you, O Lord, are gracious and full of compassion, slow to anger, and full of kindness and truth.
86:16 Turn to me and have mercy upon me; give your strength to your servant, and save the child of your handmaid.
86:17 Show me a sign of your favor, so that those who hate me may see it and be ashamed; because you, O Lord, have helped me and comforted me.

87:1 On the holy mountain stands the city he has founded; the Lord loves the gates of Zion more than all the dwellings of Jacob.
87:2 Glorious things are spoken of you, O city of our God.
87:3 I count Egypt and Babylon among those who know me; behold Philistia, Tyre, and Ethiopia: in Zion were they born.
87:4 Of Zion it shall be said, 'Everyone was born in her, and the Most High himself shall establish her.'
87:5 The Lord will record as he enlists the peoples, 'These were born there.'
87:6 The singers and the dancers will say, 'All my fresh springs are in you.'

88:1 O Lord, my God, my Savior, by day and night I cry to you.
88:2 Let my prayer enter into your presence; incline your ear to me and save me.
88:3 For I am full of trouble; my life draws near to the grave.
88:4 I am counted among those who go down into the Pit; I am like one who has no strength.
88:5 Lost among the dead, like the slain who lie in the grave,
88:6 Whom you remember no more, for they are cut off from your hand.
88:7 You have laid me in the lowest Pit, in a dark place, and in the abyss.
88:8 Your anger weighs upon me heavily, and all your great waves overwhelm me.
88:9 You have put my friends far from me; you have made me to be abhorred by them; I am in prison and cannot get out.
88:10 My sight has failed me because of trouble; Lord, I have called upon you daily; I have stretched out my hands to you.
88:11 Do you work wonders for the dead? will those who have died stand up and praise you?
88:12 Will your loving-kindness be declared in the grave? your faithfulness in the land of destruction?
88:13 Will your wonders be known in the dark? or your righteousness in the country where all is forgotten?
88:14 But as for me, O Lord, I cry to you for help; in the morning my prayer comes before you.
88:15 Lord, why have you rejected me? why have you hidden your face from me?
88:16 Ever since my youth, I have been wretched and at the point of death; I have borne your terrors with a troubled mind.
88:17 Your blazing anger has swept over me; your terrors have destroyed me;
88:18 They surround me all day long like a flood; they encompass me on every side.
88:19 My friend and my neighbor you have put away from me, and darkness is my only companion.

18.heading: Psalms 90, 91, 92
18.text:
90:1 Lord, you have been our refuge from one generation to another.
90:2 Before the mountains were brought forth, or the earth and the world were made, from age to age you are God.
90:3 You turn us back to the dust and say, 'Go back, O child of earth.'
90:4 For a thousand years in your sight are like yesterday when it is past and like a watch in the night.
90:5 You sweep us away like a dream; we fade away suddenly like the grass.
90:6 In the morning it is green and flourishes; in the evening it is dried up and withered.
90:7 For we consume away in your displeasure; we are afraid at your wrathful indignation.
90:8 Our iniquities you have set before you, and our secret sins in the light of your countenance.
90:9 When you are angry, all our days are gone; we bring our years to an end like a sigh.
90:10 The span of our life is seventy years, perhaps in strength even eighty; yet the sum of them is but labor and sorrow, for they pass away quickly and we are gone.
90:11 Who regards the power of your wrath? who rightly fears your indignation?
90:12 So teach us to number our days that we may apply our hearts to wisdom.
90:13 Return, O Lord; how long will you tarry? be gracious to your servants.
90:14 Satisfy us with your loving-kindness in the morning; so shall we rejoice and be glad all the days of our life.
90:15 Make us glad by the measure of the days that you afflicted us and the years in which we suffered adversity.
90:16 Show your servants your works and your splendor to their children.
90:17 May the graciousness of the Lord our God be upon us; prosper the work of our hands; prosper our handiwork.

91:1 He who dwells in the shelter of the Most High, abides under the shadow of the Almighty.
91:2 He shall say to the Lord, 'You are my refuge and my stronghold, my God in whom I put my trust.'
91:3 He shall deliver you from the snare of the hunter and from the deadly pestilence.
91:4 He shall cover you with his pinions, and you shall find refuge under his wings; his faithfulness shall be a shield and buckler.
91:5 You shall not be afraid of any terror by night, nor of the arrow that flies by day;
91:6 Of the plague that stalks in the darkness, nor of the sickness that lays waste at mid-day.
91:7 A thousand shall fall at your side and ten thousand at your right hand, but it shall not come near you.
91:8 Your eyes have only to behold to see the reward of the wicked.
91:9 Because you have made the Lord your refuge, and the Most High your habitation,
91:10 There shall no evil happen to you, neither shall any plague come near your dwelling.
91:11 For he shall give his angels charge over you, to keep you in all your ways.
91:12 They shall bear you in their hands, lest you dash your foot against a stone.
91:13 You shall tread upon the lion and adder; you shall trample the young lion and the serpent under your feet.
91:14 Because he is bound to me in love, therefore will I deliver him; I will protect him, because he knows my Name.
91:15 He shall call upon me, and I will answer him; I am with him in trouble; I will rescue him and bring him to honor.
91:16 With long life will I satisfy him and show him my salvation.

92:1 It is a good thing to give thanks to the Lord and to sing praises to your Name, O Most High;
92:2 To tell of your loving-kindness early in the morning and of your faithfulness in the night season;
92:3 On the ten-stringed instrument and on the lute, and with the solemn sound of the harp.
92:4 For you, Lord, have made me glad by your acts, and I sing for joy at the works of your hands.
92:5 Lord, how glorious are your works! your thoughts are very deep.
92:6 The dullard does not know, nor does the fool understand, that though the wicked grow like grass and all the workers of iniquity flourish,
92:7 It is only to be destroyed for ever; but you, Lord, are exalted for evermore.
92:8 For lo, your enemies, O Lord, lo, your enemies shall perish, and all the workers of iniquity shall be scattered.
92:9 But my horn you have exalted like the horns of wild bulls; I am anointed with fresh oil.
92:10 My eyes also look down upon my enemies, and my ears hear with joy the end of the wicked who rise up against me.
92:11 The righteous shall flourish like a palm tree and shall spread abroad like a cedar of Lebanon.
92:12 Those who are planted in the house of the Lord shall flourish in the courts of our God;
92:13 They shall still bring forth fruit in old age; they shall be green and succulent;
92:14 That they may show how upright the Lord is, my Rock, in whom there is no fault.

19.heading: Psalms 95, 96, 97
19.text:
95:1 Come, let us sing to the Lord; let us shout for joy to the Rock of our salvation.
95:2 Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving and raise a loud shout to him with psalms.
95:3 For the Lord is a great God, and a great King above all gods.
95:4 In his hand are the caverns of the earth, and the heights of the hills are his also.
95:5 The sea is his, for he made it, and his hands have molded the dry land.
95:6 Come, let us bow down, and bend the knee, and kneel before the Lord our Maker.
95:7 For he is our God, and we are the people of his pasture and the sheep of his hand. Oh, that today you would hearken to his voice!
95:8 Harden not your hearts, as your forebears did in the wilderness, at Meribah, and on that day at Massah, when they tempted me.
95:9 They put me to the test, though they had seen my works.
95:10 Forty years long I detested that generation and said, 'This people are wayward in their hearts; they do not know my ways.'
95:11 So I swore in my wrath, 'They shall not enter into my rest.'

96:1 Sing to the Lord a new song; sing to the Lord, all the whole earth.
96:2 Sing to the Lord and bless his Name; proclaim the good news of his salvation from day to day.
96:3 Declare his glory among the nations and his wonders among all peoples.
96:4 For great is the Lord and greatly to be praised; he is more to be feared than all gods.
96:5 As for all the gods of the nations, they are but idols; but it is the Lord who made the heavens.
96:6 Oh, the majesty and magnificence of his presence! Oh, the power and the splendor of his sanctuary!
96:7 Ascribe to the Lord, you families of the peoples; ascribe to the Lord honor and power.
96:8 Ascribe to the Lord the honor due his Name; bring offerings and come into his courts.
96:9 Worship the Lord in the beauty of holiness; let the whole earth tremble before him.
96:10 Tell it out among the nations: 'The Lord is King! he has made the world so firm that it cannot be moved; he will judge the peoples with equity.'
96:11 Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad; let the sea thunder and all that is in it; let the field be joyful and all that is therein.
96:12 Then shall all the trees of the wood shout for joy before the Lord when he comes, when he comes to judge the earth.
96:13 He will judge the world with righteousness and the peoples with his truth.

97:1 The Lord is King; let the earth rejoice; let the multitude of the isles be glad.
97:2 Clouds and darkness are round about him, righteousness and justice are the foundations of his throne.
97:3 A fire goes before him and burns up his enemies on every side.
97:4 His lightnings light up the world; the earth sees it and is afraid.
97:5 The mountains melt like wax at the presence of the Lord, at the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.
97:6 The heavens declare his righteousness, and all the peoples see his glory.
97:7 Confounded be all who worship carved images and delight in false gods! Bow down before him, all you gods.
97:8 Zion hears and is glad, and the cities of Judah rejoice, because of your judgments, O Lord.
97:9 For you are the Lord, most high over all the earth; you are exalted far above all gods.
97:10 The Lord loves those who hate evil; he preserves the lives of his saints and delivers them from the hand of the wicked.
97:11 Light has sprung up for the righteous, and joyful gladness for those who are true of heart.
97:12 Rejoice in the Lord, you righteous, and give thanks to his holy Name.

20.heading: Psalms 102, 103
20.text:
102:1 Lord, hear my prayer, and let my cry come before you.
102:2 Hide not your face from me in the day of my trouble; incline your ear to me; when I call, make haste to answer me.
102:3 For my days drift away like smoke, and my bones are hot as burning coals.
102:4 My heart is smitten like grass and withered, so that I forget to eat my bread.
102:5 Because of the voice of my groaning I am but skin and bones.
102:6 I am like an owl in the desert, like a little owl among the ruins.
102:7 I lie awake and groan; I am like a sparrow, alone upon a housetop.
102:8 My enemies revile me all day long, and those who scoff at me have taken an oath against me.
102:9 For I have eaten ashes for bread and mingled my drink with weeping.
102:10 Because of your indignation and wrath you have lifted me up and thrown me away.
102:11 My days are like a passing shadow, and I wither like the grass.
